name: Bad Side / Bad Energy - Split 7"
description:
BM0026 - Bad Energy / Bad Side - Split 7"
Two new hardcore bands from Philly. Both have the word "BAD" in their name, so it had be done. Both bands also released stellar demos this past winter. This split 7" compiles both demos on the ever-popular, 'penultimate' split 7inch Format (at least it's not a 10inch). Anyone could have released this as two separate records and price gouged the hell out of an already price gouged, record-buying public. We decided to save everyone some bucks and do it this way. Wanna fight about it? The "Energy side" is 5 songs of chaotic, weirdo hc, at just over 6min. The "Side side" is 6 songs of tight, fast hardcore, totaling 5min09sec.  Listen for yourself, using the link at the end of this announcement.

300 pressed on purple-y-brown marbled wax. Black and white, heavy-stock jackets, and who knows... Maybe an insert of some kind, as well. We also have a couple copies of the 2 song Bad Side 7" from Nervous Habits Records. Again, you can hear both sides, and purchase mp3s and whatnot at the link below.


Bad Energy:
A1. Numbed -- 1:34
A2. Mondo Cane -- 0:52
A3. Live My Life -- 1:13
A4. Community Creeper DFC -- 0:53
A5. Mind Hole 1:46

Bad Side:
B1. Looking For A Bad Time -- 0:47
B2. I Can't Change -- 1:13
B3. Rich Kids On THC -- 0:55
B4. Bleak Future -- 0:59
B5. Humiliator -- 0:49
B6. Mind Entrapment -- 0:27


Listen to the record:  http://badmasterrecords.bandcamp.com/


INDIVIDUAL ORDERS (US & International) can be made here, through our online store, or by PayPal'in direct to badmasterrecords@gmail.com to the tune of $7.50. We'll do both 7"es for $12.50ppd. If you want us to throw in a Dopestroke 7", as well, make it $17.00ppd.

WHOLESALERS / STORES / DISTRIBUTORS (orders of 5 or more) can be made by email, at badmasterrecords[at]gmail[dot]com. Wholesale rate is $3.75 each, plus shipping. For orders of 20 or more, we can go down to $3.50 per.

name: Bad Side 'Everybody Wants Something From Me' 7"
description:
NHR002 - Bad Side 'Everybody Wants Something From Me' 7"
Two more jammers from West Philadelphia's Bad Side! 

Here is what SPIN.COM (?!) had to say: "Philadelphia's Bad Side want to maintain an air of mystery. Before the hardcore punks played their first show, they flooded their hometown with hand-drawn posters that ask a simple question: "Who is Bad Side?" For now, let's say they're a bruising five-piece that specialize in sabre-toothed guitar shredding and deliriously barked vocals. For proof, stream the enigmatic outfit's newest track, the unrelenting "Locked Up in the Decompression Room," below.

name: Badmaster T-shirt - SOLD OUT
description: The second run of t-shirts. Black ink Monster Face logo on white t's. Printed by Thomas Dean @ Lost Woods Prints. 30 in total. Be one of the lucky few to own this highly unique and sought after article of regional-music-endorsing body covering! Walk in to a room, with Full Assurance, that you'll be the only one wearing it!! YAEHH!!  NOTE: Small size is sold out at the moment. We will get a couple more made very soon (just a couple!)

name: DOPESTROKE 'S/T' 7" EP
description: The Self-titled, debut 7" EP for Philadelphia's DOPESTROKE! A 5 song rager, presented on the ever-popular 7 inch, vinyl format. Nihilist punk channeling the unrepentant anger and hardcore speed of Rudimentary Peni and Dissucks while also drawing influence from the classic buzzsaw guitar melody of The Freeze. Live shows have been compared to Out Cold, Void, and Easy Action. 300 pressed on black vinyl. $5.00

name: V/A - Bloodstains Across Philadelphia 12" Compilation
description:
NO LESSONS LEARNED , THE TROWELS , SELF CONSCIOUS, BAD DOCTORS, NO COFFINS, BUCKET FLUSH, ARDMORE ASSAULT, NOTHING IS OVER, COUSIN BRIAN, GONE WRONG, LIGHTEN UP, BLOOD BOMBER, DOPESTROKE, DRY FEET, POPULATION ZERO, NIGHTFALL, LAFFING LIFE & MORE!  Includes 24 page booklet. 
Eaglebauer Enterprises (EE-03) Released June 2011.

name: Shit & Shine 'Bass Puppy' 12" Single
description: BM0022 Shit & Shine 'Bass Puppy' 12" Single 2 long tracks wherein the Shit & Shine aesthetic is applied to that of the Dub-Step (?) genre. Think the "loop-iness" & humor of Strangulated Beat-offs mixed with the more future-primitive, cybernetic, percussive interludes found on FNU Ronnies' 'Golem Smoke', then hit it with a couple ecstasy pills and BOOM! Bass Puppy! Side A: Bass Puppy 8:28 | Side B: Fuck You Folk Singers 9:55 500 pressed. Includes high quality mp3 download coupon. $10.00 + shipping Click the 'play' button to preview.

name: Pop. 1280 / Hot Guts Split 7"
description: BM0023 - Pop. 1280 / Hot Guts Split 7" The newest release to our continuing split 7" series. This pairing joins New York City creepers Pop 1280 and Philadelphia misanthropes Hot Guts. Two bands, that hold great things in the years to come, bring two sides of dark, brooding post-punk with wire tight rhythm sections. Almost industrial, with enough pop-driven momentum to make you wanna move. Songs you will remember after you've walked away from the turntable. Click the 'play' button to preview.

name: AIDS Wolf / Satanized Split 7"
description: BM0021 - AIDS Wolf / Satanized Split 7" Ltd.500 / marbled pink vinyl. 2 un-released AIDS Wolf tracks & 1 long Satanized cut, housed in a 5 color silk screened jacket, inside and out, by Seripop. Side A. AW- 1. Tango Fatal 2. In And Under The Snow (produced by Weasel Walter) Side B. STNZD- Hope Is Lack of Information (Recorded by Ben G. @ Bulletproof Chinese, Mastered by Weasel Walter) AIDS Wolf (montreal) and Satanized (philly) have joined forces to create a musical document of startling ugliness. The first of two Aids Wolf songs brings to mind a modern Harry Pussy piece or what it might sound like if 4 people with shotgun wounds to the gut were thrown in a pitch black room and left to scamper around looking for an exit that does not exist. (haha, who writes this shit?) The second is classic Aids Wolf, that could have easily landed on their Cities of Glass LP. The Satanized side sounds like a 24 hour shift at a steel mill turned mental institution that only employs the criminally insane. Lots of blood everywhere on this one. Brutal sonic violence. Satanized produce a truly great recording that captures everything that makes this band so awe-inspiring in a live setting. This 7" will leave you holding your lover a little bit closer at night and questioning the morality of bringing a child into this uncaring world. There are some sounds that you can't unhear... and why would you? Click the 'play' button to preview.

name: Mincemeat or Tenspeed / Drums Like Machine Guns Split 12"
description:
MINCEMEAT OR TENSPEED/
DRUMS LIKE MACHINE GUNS split 12"
Ltd 500 


"The lo-fi, bedroom-bound, Philly tweaker version of the current joynoise whoosh of Fuck Buttons and High Places: Mincemeat Or Tenspeed is more reserved and more 8-bit, but no less hypnotic if you stumble into his laser trail. Davey Harms, the lone Meatman, purports to be a failed techno electrogeek (he didn't have any gear), who haxx0rd his way into dance bliss using only guitar pedals (dude didn’t even have a computer). And while everyone from Black Dice to Gang Gang Dance to Growing makes Line6-boogie these days, Mincemeat foregoes the broken Kompakt beats and choppy scuzz and makes a beeline for Ibiza, trying to coat everything in a warm trance, barely focusing on the beat at all beyond a dull throb. In fact, the beat changes like four times—from engine purr to martial mosh to a noise mambo to a sparse gamelan patter. Maybe because Harms is a rhythm-layering savant, maybe because it's uncontrollable, as most of the beats are thuds made by mixer feedback." Paper Thin Walls


"[Drums Like Machine Guns] are so relentless on the on first listen this seems much more like an attack then music. Step away from confronting these tunes and the record listens pretty damn good. Mincemeat or Tenspeed at first comes off as a smart ass take on Steve Reich, but builds some riffs, shatters some rhythms, shifts into new hooks and grooves through. This is loud minimalism.  Drums Like Machine Guns owes more to early Industrial noise than minimalism, but it to attempts to do more with less. Drums succeeds and build some pretty tremendous sounds."

BM009 (2007)

name: Tickley Feather 's/t' 12"
description:
TICKLEY FEATHER
'Self-Titled' 12"
Ltd. to 500

"twenty track collection of naievty and lo-fi whimsy. All recorded on four track and collected from the past four years experimentation, Tickley Feather is lone female; Annie Sachs known for touring as support to Animal Collective with whom she shares a love of lo-budget instrumentation, heavily treated vocals and FX, but most of all the simple charms of a simply song sung with originality and personality. The keyboards plink and plonk, the drum machines clatter and spurt whilst the vocals come swathed in reverbed mesh of cavernous depth. Beyond twee, the tracks are so short if you blink you'd miss them. What's so endearingly appealing is the honesty and sheer guile of the approach taken. Stripped of vocals this would even make a very good lo-fi electronica opus.There's no comparing, fortunately." Some guy on the internet

"Tickley Feather are a bit of a revelation; trancey, elliptical folk/drum machine gallops that lilt with melody and feature these gorgeous female vocals. Annie Sachs has got a great one, especially in its higher registers, where she almost resembles Liz Fraser or Siouxsie. Hometaping sands off the edges roughly, but that makes it sound even more open and lost inside itself." Dusted Mag

"Tickley Feather is Annie Sachs, and what she does is something akin to the very soul of 'acid folk', although its not ancient sounding and, indeed, doesnt really sound much like anything else at all. The arrangements , vocals and lyrics all have a certain lightness, but they're twisted in all sorts of directions and the results are stunning" WIRE

"Tickley Feather is dosed with all the lush space whisper 'n ache of Gilli Smyth or Helen Johnstone pasted & cut over an aural veneer of THAT sort've determined instrumentation that has become a hallmark amongst the finest in the Finnish underground. Were I a bettin man, I'd have wagered this would've been something off the Weird Forest label. That it's from here in town is practically cause for celebration. You's bring the spirits. The crow cassoulet 'n humble pie's on me." Siltblog

Mixed and Produced by Rusty Santos
BM0014 (2008)

name: Satanized -Sickness & Hellth: The Secular chansons of Satanized CD
description:
SATANIZED
Sickness & Hellth:
'The Secular Chansons of...' CD
Ltd 500


Coming Soon: Aids Wolf / Satanized Split 7" (Nov 09)

Satanized is a chaotic noise rock band from Philadelphia, PA consisting of guitar, bass, drums, turntable and vocals. Scathing treble frequencies and heavy rhythms, alternately slicing and pummeling the listener, are made all the more freakish sounding by occasional moments of high musical complexity occurring amidst the assault.

"They tend toward simplicity, primitiveness, and stupidity but they are very smart. Lipson's songs shove the talents of a very musically skilled band into a pretty tight tube and give the playing focus. They have a turntable and use it as an instrument and not a gimmick. Makes me think of a schizophrenic wasp trapped in a hot bottle." – Z-GUN



Art by Hunter Stabler
BM0010 (2007)

name: Ultrathin 'Glass City' b/w 'Don't Mess' 7" - SOLD OUT
description: The debut 7" for Montreal's Ultrathin. 3 young gents, 1 of which is of the band The Pink Noise, playing high-octane, garage-y, loud as hell punk. This is the serious shit. Two over-the-top, power punk anthems. Like a cherry red bullet ripping down the same high-way The Stooges & Mayyors used to get to the bank and back. Twisted, over-blown guitars, oozing bass sleaze, the relentless pounding of drums and a manic freak behind the mic, power this 'back to basics' rock-n-ripper. Only 300 pressed. Click the 'play' button to preview.

name: Leather 'Anchorite' 7" - SOLD OUT
description:
Leather 'Anchorite' 7" (CC001)

"Mid-paced Black Flag tempo with good riffing, talented drumming and just the right number of stops and starts. By the time the locked-groove ending of “Anchorite” hits, it’s hard to not be at least a little impressed. 
These four tracks offer a distinct and somewhat unique sound, although remaining firmly grounded in the hardcore punk echelon. Their advantage is mainly due to the voice of Alex Agran, who, when not using a wounded-dog scream, actually kind of sings. It genuinely connects Leather’s sound to classic hardcore punk (I’m thinking the American Youth Report compilation for reference), as Agran’s voice recalls a classic Keith Morris or Alec Mackaye, not one of today’s muffled and distorted dime-a-dozen hardcore screamers. “Prince of the Salon” takes that voice to its most intense degree, almost to an off-putting level, but a similar sensation was probably felt the first time anyone heard Darby Crash." -www.yellowgreenred.com
Released by Caesar Cuts 2010.

name: Hot Guts 'S/t' 7" SOLD OUT
description: Hot Guts Debut release. 'Ballad of Jon Simon' 7" 3 songs, all different. BM0020 (2009) Click the 'play' button to preview.

name: My Mind 'Fed Up With Myself' Single-sided 12"  SOLD OUT
description:
My Mind 'Fed Up With Myself'' EP
(HARVEST005)
Single-sided 12" on Clear Vinyl with Screenprinted B side

Fed Up with My Self – De Gustibus Non Est Disputandum is the second "proper" record from Philadelphia's My Mind, a follow-up to their Path Masher 7" released in 2009 on Badmaster Records. This one-sided 12" is an ambitious step sideways in composition and execution, as the relatively straight-forward delivery of 60 second pop-punk songs has been replaced by a pretentious song-cycle/rock-opera format, and turgid lyrical content concerned with the familiar topics of Kontemporary Konsumer Kulture, religious confusion, and war.

Features contributions from Adam Cooper (Akasha Blade) and Brendan O'Connor (Serpents of Wisdom)

One-sided clear vinyl 12", b-side hand-silkscreened with terror image, pressed at 45rpm for maximum anguish, edition of 100

For fans of: The Who, The Kinks, Sparks, Crass
